definition: to ponder earnestly/to give a lot of thought to sth
to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
good/very/very much
bitter/hardship/pain/to suffer/to bring suffering to/painstakingly

sentences.english: President Barack Obama has gone even further in trying to reach out to the Muslim world.
sentences.chinese: 奧巴馬總統更是用心良苦，試着去和穆斯林世界交流。

sentences.english: Make it small, well intentioned mistake with a positive lesson learned.
sentences.chinese: 它使小型，用心良苦弄錯了積極的教訓。

sentences.english: The workers here are so considerate.
sentences.chinese: 工作人員真是用心良苦。

sentences.english: Was it a well-meaning parent who wanted you to grow up and be independent?
sentences.chinese: 用心良苦的父母希望你長大後完全獨立了嗎？

definition: to ponder earnestly/to give a lot of thought to sth
to take a lot of trouble (idiom); painstaking/at the cost of a lot of effort
painstaking effort/to take a lot of trouble/laborious at pains
motive/intention/to be diligent or attentive/careful
to bother/to press sb, usu. to do sth/it's a tough job/sorry to bother you (polite, used to thank sb for a favor)
to make painstaking efforts (idiom); after much trouble/to work hard at sth
to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through
lit. deep plans and distant thoughts/to plan far ahead (idiom)
to kill two birds with one stone (idiom)
hard-earned capital
ginger gets spicier as it gets older (idiom)/the older, the wiser
pinyin: jiang1 hai2 shi4 lao3 de5 la4

definition: to hit the mark with a comment (idiom)/to say sth spot on
intention/purpose
to rack one's brains for schemes (idiom)/to beat one's brains out
words from the bottom of one's heart
to waste (one's breath, one's energy etc)/to try in vain
